ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Synthetic organic chemistry techniques and reactions.
Synthetic pathways to convert one type of molecule into another; mostly stereoselective carbonyl reactions
Common and practical synthesis methods of organic molecules used in industry and in academia.
An awareness of synthetic methods in organic chemistry. It provided a quite extensive survey of methods I had not known of before and built well on an intro organic chemistry class.
Taking this course has definitely helped me understand chemical reactivity beyond the level of orgo 2, which I'm really excited to be learning about!
I gained a larger insight with regards to executing reactions with enolates, aldols, and other compounds.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Introduces a variety of organic transformations. Solidifes your understanding of these transformations through the problem sets. Problem sets are of appropriate difficulty, and the lowest score is dropped. Exam being open book is also a plus.

Feedback on problem sets should be more clear, and the answer keys to the problem sets occasionally cut corners/jump steps and do not provide entirely clear explanations.

Strengths -- useful content, in-depth, very knowledgeable professor

Weaknesses -- overwhelming; the notes on Canvas are really useful, and I think it would be really helpful to have Canvas content reviewing relevant fundamentals for students who took organic chemistry a while ago
I don't think I would improve/change the course in any way. The problem sets are great practice but not too much work for a weekly basis, and lecture is always interesting and run at a great pace.
The only major weakness is the under-utilization of Canvas.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this as a beginning advanced elective for the chemistry major.
Very useful if you intend to do any synthesis research at any point
Yes, especially for anyone looking to get into synthesis in some way. Prof. Ellman is great at teaching, even though he must move quite quickly to cover all the topics.
I would definitely recommend this course, especially for organic students due to the content. But aside from that, Professor Ellman is a great teacher and very approachable for questions.
I would only recommend if they were going for a Chemistry degree.
